com.milk.timer
Class TimedRun

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.timer.TimedRun
All Implemented Interfaces:
Orderable
public final class TimedRun
extends java.lang.Object
implements Orderable

TimedRun is the way to get something to run based on the passage of time. A TimedRun will run its Runnable at most once per scheduling. If it hasn't yet run and it gets rescheduled, then the previous scheduling is implicitly canceled. Note that, in general, the TimedRun system will ignore all exceptions caused by running the Runnables that it is handed. The Runnables are responsible for handling their own exceptions. However, with debugging turned on, such ignored exceptions do get spit to System.err.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

cancel

public void cancel()
Cancel this TimedRun. This has no effect if it never had a schedule in the first place, if it had already done its run, or it had already been canceled.

schedule

public void schedule(long when)
Schedule or reschedule this TimedRun to happen the given amount of time in the future.

Parameters:
when - when in the future (in msec) the run should happen
